content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  May 31 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an expected rating of 'B(EXP)' to CIT Group Inc.'s (CIT) perpetual preferred securities. The preferred securities are expected to be subordinate to existing and future indebtedness but senior to common units. Distributions  when and if declared by the board of directors  will be payable semi-annually until June 15  2022  after which distributions will be payable quarterly. Distribution

title: Fitch Expects to Rate CIT Group's Preferred Stock 'B'

content: Avolon Holdings Ltd  part of China's acquisitive HNA Group  said on Thursday it agreed to buy the aircraft leasing business of CIT Group Inc  for $10 billion to create the world's third-largest aircraft leasing company.

title: Avolon Holdings to buy CIT Group's aircraft leasing unit for $10 billion

content: CIT Group Inc  said Chief Executive Officer John Thain  who was appointed to turn around the commercial lender after its bankruptcy  will retire in March and be replaced by veteran banking executive Ellen Alemany.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)
title: Veteran banker John Thain to retire as CIT CEO next year

content: Oct 21 CIT Group Inc said Chief Executive Officer John Thain  who was appointed to turn around the commercial lender after its bankruptcy  will retire in March and be replaced by veteran banking executive Ellen Alemany.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)
title: UPDATE 3-Veteran banker John Thain to retire as CIT CEO next year

content: Oct 21 U.S. small-business lender CIT Group Inc  said Chief Executive John Thain will retire effective March 31  2016 and be replaced by Ellen Alemany  a CIT board member.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)
title: CORRECTED-CIT Group CEO John Thain to retire next year

content: NEW YORK  Aug 3 CIT Group Chairman and Chief Executive Officer John Thain  who closed a merger Monday with OneWest Bank that acquired $30 billion in deposits  said financial companies that do not have deposit funding could be shaky in the future.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)
title: CIT's Thain: financial companies without deposit funding face risks

content: NEW YORK When U.S. companies go bust  bankruptcy laws ensure workers are among the first to get paid. Now an unconventional settlement in an obscure case threatens to turn that guarantee on its head.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)
title: Trucker's bankruptcy exit may roughen road for small creditors

content: NEW YORK  June 24 When U.S. companies go bust  bankruptcy laws ensure workers are among the first to get paid. Now an unconventional settlement in an obscure case threatens to turn that guarantee on its head.
name: CIT Group Inc (DEL)

title: Lessor CIT orders five more Airbus A321 planes

title: Huntington Bancshares to buy Macquarie unit - sources
